revised_title: Advances in Host-Vector Systems for Genetic Engineering
tldr: The article discusses the advancements made in host-vector systems for genetic engineering in the eight years since the Spinks report. It highlights the expansion of the range and sophistication of host-vector systems, focusing on eukaryotic systems where significant progress has been made. The article also covers the basic features of eukaryotic gene expression vectors, advances in vector design, and potential future applications of these systems.
